title: The Doctrine of Discovery
description: One-minute skill: The Doctrine of Discovery.

hook.text: In 1493, Pope Alexander VI drew a line on a map and split the entire New World between Spain and Portugal.

buildup.text: The Doctrine of Discovery said European nations could claim any land not already held by Christians.

discovery.text: Indigenous peoples living on that land for thousands of years were legally invisible under this rule.

twist.text: Other colonial powers â€” England, France, the Netherlands â€” adopted the same principle for their own claims.

climax.text: The U.S. Supreme Court cited this doctrine as recently as 1823 to deny Native land rights.

punchline.text: A papal decree still echoes in modern land law.

quiz.question: What did the Doctrine of Discovery allow European nations to do?
options: Claim non-Christian lands as their own
